dc:title: Spring Appeal - March 1968
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Asks for aid describing their crowded tenement, and notes the coming and going of the young as well as the needs of older long-term guests. Looks for signs of spring after a hard winter. In spite of poverty she admits how acquisitive they can be for books, time, and loving kindness.
